A viral video making the rounds on social media on Election Day shows a man being turned away from a Philadelphia polling station.
"You're not letting me in?" asks the man, who later identifies himself as a poll watcher with a "citywide certificate."
The two poll workers at the door, a man and a woman, tell the poll watcher his certificate is not "for this location" despite his repeated insistence.
"I asked you to read the line, the line says it's good in every ward and division in the city," he is heard saying toward the end of the 33-second video clip.
Twitter quickly took to condemning the video, stating the poll workers' actions were "illegal," however others noted the man was not wearing a mask as recommended by the city's health department.

The Trump campaign's national Election Day operations director, Mike Roman, retweeted the video early Tuesday morning, declaring "DEMOCRAT ELECTION OFFICIALS BANNING TRUMP POLL WATCHERS IN PHILLY. This is happening all over the City. The steal is on!"
An image of a watcher's certificate issuedto a Gary Feldman is also provided as further proof of the man's claim.
Fact check:Pennsylvania voters exposed to COVID-19 can still vote
In the video shot by Will Chamberlain, editor of the conservative magazine Human Events, a man was turned away from a polling station in Philadelphia’s Point Breeze neighborhood.

A spokesperson for the Philadelphia City Commissioners' office stated the act was "an honest mistake." Kevin Feely said during a phone call with BuzzFeed News that the man had a different ward than what was written on his certificate. An older version of the law pertaining to poll watchers maintained such individuals must be assigned to specific wards, which was why the poll worker mistakenly turned the man away.
Once the error was realized, the man was permitted back.
"This person was allowed to enter and is there now,” Feely said.
The city's district attorney's office also denied any other complaints of a poll watcher being denied entrance.
“Our Election Task Force has not received any complaints that fit what is being described or alleged in that tweet," said spokeswoman Jane Roh to BuzzFeed News.
Fact check:Post about Biden-Harris bus incident involving 'Trump Train' missing context

We rate this claim MISSING CONTEXT, because without additional context it might be misleading. It is true a poll watcher was turned away from a Philadelphia polling station due to a legal misunderstanding but he was allowed back in after the mistake was recognized. This appears to be an isolated incident; no other incidents have been reported to Philadelphia's Election Task Force.
